inlineContent.text: Is taking the data, and depending on what is collected, organising it in a way that is understadable and (most of the time) useful. In a nutshell, it’s
Is taking the graph and making sense of the data inside it, it is different from handling raw data. In a nutshell, it’s
- Scales are not uniform, or are not labelled properly
- Axes are not labelled properly, or are not uniform (units)
- Data is not proportional to the size of the graph
- Data is missing, or is not shown properly
- Title is not a good representation of the data
Most common value of the data
we want to find the common values of a set of data :P
*I trust that you know how to calculate those 3…
Difference between the highest and lowest values
Interquartile Range = Upper Quartile - Lower Quartile
Difference between the upper and lower quartiles
Measure of how spread out the values are
The larger the standard deviation, the more spread out the values are
The smaller the standard deviation, the more the values are clustered around the mean/median
↳ Degree of accuracy of figures is low
↳ not good for too many classes
↳ Suitable for only small quantities of categories
↳ Cannot show the percentage of each class
↳ Can only be used to convey simple information
↳ Only applicable to time-related data or when trends are required
↳ Does not easily identify continuity of variation
↳ Best for large numbers of categories
↳ Cannot read frequency of each class unless specfied
↳ Can compare parts of a whole
↳ Difference between 2 classes cannot be read
↳ Confusing a variable has too many values
↳ Proportions need to be accurate when drawing
↳ Data is grouped, ∴ exact values are unknown
↳ Shows central tendency & dispersion of data
↳ Useful for highlighting clusters, gaps and outliers
↳ Not efficient for larger data sets
↳ Shows range, min, max, gaps, clusters and outliers easily
↳ Not advisable when there are many or few stens. Gives little information as data is very scattered
↳ Can handle extremely large data stems by splitting stems
↳ Cannot be used to find cumulative frequencies or percentiles
↳ Concise summary of a set of data (min, max, Q₁, Q₂, Q₃)
↳ Need to know min, max, median, lower and upper quartiles for construction
↳ Used to compare medians and intequartile ranges of two ro more sets of data
↳ Difficult to compare freqencies from differing groups
↳ Can find Median, Upper and Lower quartiles, interquartile range

abstract.text: Notes. A lot of them. A jumble colosseum of notes. Jumbleum.
Wishing you didn’t learn probability because your odds aren’t good
Secondary school content for the School of Science and Technology: Engineering 2024
